info.name: NHS Website Content API v2
info.description:
This API provides content from the [NHS website](https://www.nhs.uk/) as JSON, to be consumed programmatically and used by your application.

You can reuse the content from the following sections of the NHS website:

- [Health A to Z (conditions)](https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/)
- [Medicines A to Z](https://www.nhs.uk/medicines/)
- [Pregnancy](https://www.nhs.uk/pregnancy/)
- [Mental health](https://www.nhs.uk/mental-health/)
- [Live Well](https://www.nhs.uk/live-well/)
- [Common health questions](https://www.nhs.uk/common-health-questions/)
- [NHS services](https://www.nhs.uk/nhs-services/).
    

Pick a page from one of these sections on the [NHS website](https://www.nhs.uk/). Make a note of the path in the page URL (the bit that appears after '`https://www.nhs.uk/`'). You can then use this path to make API calls to the 'Integration test' environment and the 'Production' environment like so ...

**Integration test environment**

`https://int.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/YOUR_PATH_GOES_HERE`

**Production environment**

`https://api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/YOUR_PATH_GOES_HERE`

NOTE: You'll need to provide an 'apikey' in the request header. You can obtain an API key by signing up to the [NHS Digital Developer hub](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer) and getting environment access by registering your application.

For more information on using this API, please visit the [NHS Website Content API v2 documentation](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer/api-catalogue/nhs-website-content/v2).

This Postman collection makes calls to the mocked 'sandbox' environment.  
The included sample endpoints are:

## API v2 root

- [https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/](https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/) (Not a valid endpoint)
    

## Common health questions

- [https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/](https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/)
- [https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/accidents-first-aid-and-treatments/](https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/accidents-first-aid-and-treatments/)
- [https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/caring-carers-and-long-term-conditions/](https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/caring-carers-and-long-term-conditions/)
- [https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/childrens-health/can-my-baby-go-swimming-before-or-after-vaccinations/](https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/childrens-health/can-my-baby-go-swimming-before-or-after-vaccinations/)

item.name: API v2 root
API root endpoint - Resource not found

request.description: This is the 'root' of the NHS Website Content API v2. There is nothing here, and will return a '404 Resource not found' message.

item.name: Common health questions

request.description: The [common health questions hub](https://www.nhs.uk/common-health-questions/) contains a number of navigational and content pages.

item.name: Caring carers and long term conditions
Can my baby go swimming before or after vaccinations?

item.description:
The [common health questions hub](https://www.nhs.uk/common-health-questions/) contains a number of navigational and content pages.

## API v2 endpoints

**Sandbox environment**  
_Note: Only a limited number of endpoints available_  
[https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/](https://sandbox.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/)

**Integration test environment**  
_Note: A valid 'apikey' for this environment is required in the request header_  
[https://int.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/](https://int.api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/)

**Production environment**  
_Note: A valid 'apikey' for this environment is required in the request header_  
[https://api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/](https://api.service.nhs.uk/nhs-website-content/common-health-questions/)

You can get your free API key by signing up to the [NHS Digital - Developer hub](https://digital.nhs.uk/developer) and register your application in our test and production environments.
